title: 103_hr2609
content:
The "Presidential Commission on TV Violence and Children Act" is established to address the widespread increase in violence and violent crime in the United States, particularly on television programming. Research shows a causal relationship between television violence and violence in society, prompting the need for solutions to limit harmful influences while preserving freedom of expression. The Commission is tasked with finding ways to address this issue. The "Presidential Commission on TV Violence and Children" is established to review findings linking television violence to violence in children and society. The Commission will solicit opinions from children, parents, experts, and industry professionals to lessen the negative effects of television violence. It will present comprehensive strategies and solutions while preserving free expression. The Commission, composed of the Surgeon General, the Attorney General, and 26 members appointed by the President, includes individuals from various groups such as broadcast television networks, parents, public health experts, and education experts. Members serve for life, and vacancies are filled promptly. Each member of the Commission serves for life and vacancies are filled promptly. Members serve without pay, except for travel expenses as per federal regulations. Members who are federal employees or Members of Congress cannot receive additional compensation for their service on the Commission. The Commission members serve for life, vacancies are filled promptly. They receive travel expenses as per federal regulations. A majority constitutes a quorum, the Surgeon General is the chairperson, and the Attorney General is the vice chairperson. Meetings are called by the chairperson. The Commission appoints a Director and staff, who are paid according to federal regulations. The staff must adhere to civil service laws and may request personnel from federal agencies to assist in their duties. The Commission also has powers outlined in Section 7. The Commission has the authority to hold hearings, receive evidence, and obtain necessary information from government agencies. Members and agents can take actions authorized by the Commission. The Commission can also use the United States mails and receive administrative support services from the Administrator of General Services. SEC. 8. REPORTS.

The Commission will submit a final report to the President and Congress within one year of appointing its members. The report will include findings, conclusions, and recommendations for legislative and industry actions to address television violence.

SEC. 9. TERMINATION.

The Commission will dissolve 6 months after submitting the final report.

SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

$1,000,000 is authorized for implementing this Act.

SEC. 11. BUDGET ACT COMPLIANCE.

Spending authority granted by this Act is subject to appropriations Acts.
